website_summaries.verdict: Everything that a beginner would need - for a very low price.

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Iron.
customer_reviews.text: I had my old iron for over 40 years. Decided I needed a new replacement to keep from damaging the repair or project when the heating element fell out of the handle. I am very pleased with the newer technology for attaching the tips. This iron heats quickly and has worked well so far. The kit has the basics for a beginner and intermediate user. Do not expect to do volume work where a professional grade soldering station is appropriate. I don't expect to need another in my life time and this is a good one for both light duty electrical and electronic use. I recommend it for all levels of expertise.
customer_reviews.author: old-et

customer_reviews.title: HOT STUFF!
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased! I purchased this kit for repairing wiring on my drone. Excellent heat control & great selection of tips Included for various applications. Quality tool with a nice solid carrying case. Well worth the low low price!
customer_reviews.author: Gknee331

customer_reviews.title: don't bother with this
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't have bought if it said in the description that it was only for 10 minute use or less. I didn't find that out until I read the manual worndering why it wasn't working. While plugged in and on, the light could be on and everything and it will actually be off. And, the temperature dial is loose and right by your hand so it turns while in use making the heat change constantly. Horrible, I ruined several projects due to this thing cooling down while in the middle of use. save yourself the frustration and buy a quality iron.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica lebert

customer_reviews.title: Wheres my refund?!?!?
customer_reviews.text: This thing caught fire well in my hand damage the 200 dollar stereo I was trying to solder I demand a refund now
customer_reviews.author: LAWERENCE ORTIZ

customer_reviews.title: Really great quality easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have for DIY repairs.. This was the first time I was able to make a quick fix to a xmas light in no time. Really great quality easy to use, it has instructions and it is a pretty complete kit.. I really recommend this product and the seller. I am really happy with it because in past situations something that should have been fix easily ended up being a mess. My old soldering iron did not have adjustable temp. only one tip and not really suitable for small works, this can be adjusted to whatever it is you need to do. Again, I am really happy!
customer_reviews.author: Rick HC

customer_reviews.title: Terrible temp control and not hot enough
customer_reviews.text: I have had zero luck with this set. It seems well put together but the temperature control is useless and it will barely melt solder on the highest setting. The only way I can place a bead is to put the wire directly on the iron, it just does not have enough juice to heat up any substrate. I don't use the iron very often but the two times I've tried it's been completely useless. Definately worth spending an extra couple of bucks and getting a higher quality iron and control. I will say the tip and accessory selection is very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Tysonius Maximus

customer_reviews.title: Complete toolkit for soldering...but just know that...
customer_reviews.text: This is everything the aspiring electronics person would want to work with. Extraordinary value. Three things you need to know: - the iron's tips have a limited surface area for actual solder, so you can't solder really big joints - the iron's tips wear out in a few months...they lose the coating that they need to effectively solder - the iron is very light materials...expect it to need replacing every year if you do any amount of soldering at all But at this price, who cares? You can buy two or three of these kits for the price of a "normal" soldering iron.
customer_reviews.author: David Taber

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat the price
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be an honest 60 watts, and temp. adjustable. Getting both for this price is pretty good. The accessories count as freebies at this price. If you solder for a living you'll need a professional soldering station, and if so why are you looking at this one??? I'm happy with it. I've already used it and it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Alton Wroten

customer_reviews.title: If you are trying to solder ESP modules, you need this
customer_reviews.text: I have a soldering iron from the 1990s. It works, but as components get smaller, I find that I am melting components when I am trying to solder Berg connectors in place. I just got a WS2812 8X8 module for my Wemos Mini. I couldn't solder the pins. They were too small for my iron. I ordered this one for the price and the .2MM tip. I plugged it, cranked up the temperature, and had soldered all 6 connectors with minutes. My friend saw it, and used it to tack down and solder a bare ESP8266 to an expansion board. If you are a beginner, or a pro with shaky hands, you need to get this iron today!
customer_reviews.author: Chef

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value, gets very hot!
customer_reviews.text: Had very low expectations for this, as the last cheap iron I bought would barely melt solder. This thing works amazing, gets PLENTY hot for any soldering jobs I’ve come across, and the accessories it comes with are useful. Only complaint is the case is terrible, I like a case with a place for everything, everything is just tossed in this one. But for the price, I wouldn’t count off for the case. Excellent value, hopefully it lasts
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Great little portable soldering kit, better than most.
customer_reviews.text: This is actually a pretty awesome little kit, and the soldering iron is adjustable temp, reliable, and honestly better than any iron I've used. Never have trouble heating up elements and melting solder with this, a problem I've had time and time again with even high quality, mid-range price single temp irons. Plus it comes with a lot of great tools, is super easy to store and portable. Fits easily in toolboxes.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Got the job done
customer_reviews.text: Got this to replace battery in my old zune hd mp3 player to use at my job (doesn't allow phones, or any portable devices with cameras or microphones, or Bluetooth connections). Was able to fix my device, but the zune parts are so small, would have been nice to have some more parts or tools to help with micro soldering. Was very difficult to solder the small connections with small parts in close quarters with the tools that were supplied. Could be lack of skill on my part (never soldered before)
customer_reviews.author: Aeon Psych

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy.
customer_reviews.text: Broke after a handful of uses. While changing out to a different tip the plastic nut cracked in half thus rendering the soldering iron useless.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Frequent tip changes may result in faster wear.
customer_reviews.text: After years of owning this (although use more so recently and sat on shelf for some time) overall this is a good product. Unfortunately for me, it has come to an end. The “nut” that screws down to hold the tip in place was never a smooth turn - but rather a very rough screw-on. I think it is now stripped or something as I can’t get it in place properly anymore resulting in a tip that moves around. The rest of the iron seems to work and I hate to throw this thing in the trash. Seems like an opportunity to improve it as that Is the only major failing point of this iron.
customer_reviews.author: Matt S

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: This little inexpensive kit served a disposes/ eviction notice to the Weller sitting in my tool bag. I originally bought a Weller from home depot for 30 bucks and it was riddled wit issues and extremely unforgiving with my soldering shortcomings. This unit however is a pleasure. I can't believe I got such a nice unit with so many tips for such a cheap price. It solders excellently. Has temperature control, 4 additional tips, the usual flimsy iron holder and the cord is a little short. The short cord shouldn't be an issue if you have a workstation with an outlet at table height.
customer_reviews.author: Alkad Mzu

customer_reviews.title: Don't THink this works correctly.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace an old one I had from Harbor Freight. This is actually supposed to be more powerful yet it doesn't seem to get hot enough to actually melt the sauder. Very comfortable feel and comes with plenty accessories. But not worth it if it doesn't actually do the job it was purchased for. My son-n-law was trying to fix my granddaughter radio and couldn't get it to work right. I'm going to try it myself and decide if it really needs to be returned. I really thhink I might have to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: JeRenia F.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent fine-tip soldering iron for price
customer_reviews.text: The iron is comfortably small, yet has a built-in temperature control, heats rapidly and is powerful enough for most PCB and other small and moderate soldering tasks. It comes in a nice plastic case, with five extra tips (two fine tips, angle and wedge tips, and a cylindrical tip for larger areas), extra 60/40 Sn/Pb rosin solder, a small sheet-metal stand and a tiny tip sponge. It's been useful on fine PCB work, and may become my preferred soldering tool.
customer_reviews.author: MoisheP

customer_reviews.title: Woah
customer_reviews.text: For the price I'm really impressed with this! After using this for a few projects I've tossed my other irons. The tips are easy to change and replace.. after it's cooled down of coarse. The temperature is easy to control. And it comes in a nice case with everything you need to jump into soldering. The only thing I would change is have a longer power cord, my desk set up doesn't have convinient power outlets so it's more my problem that this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Buddy Guy

customer_reviews.title: Decent little soldering iron, but keep the temperature down
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this soldering iron to recap a vintage amplifier, and it's worked great so far for about 100 components. However, keep the temperature dial all the way down and gradually work up from there, as the dial is definitely not precise and the whole iron will get warm to the touch. If you're doing light hobby work with around 63/37 or 60/40 solder, you'll be good to go at the lowest dial setting with the iron resting with the tip elevated.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew M

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Get Hot Any More!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great the first week I got it, several months later I went to use it again and it no longer gets hot enough. Takes 30 seconds of holding the tip to the wire before solder will transfer over. Garbage. Will be looking for a quality one from a quality brand. You get what you pay for. One time use I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Greg + Lynette

customer_reviews.title: I would look at another model , brand one not made of soft metal and plastic for reaining the bits
customer_reviews.text: I found the soldering iron to heat fine and extra tips and rest of kit to be worthy of $20.00 .. but hard to change out tips when the soft material for retaining nut to change out tips is so soft only after about 6 change outs of tips the threads all but wore out , the plastic part surrounding the retaining nut also got so hot it shattered .. i was in the middle of a solder job and had to super glue back the pieces so i could atleast finish the current solder job .. i will be sending this one back . Didnt last very long . 2-3 soldering jobs ..
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: A Slam-Dunk Wonder. Great value. Great Kit.
customer_reviews.text: I needed an entire kit to make a couple repairs to some computer mice I wanted to save from the junk heap. This kit is awesome. It's got everything you could need and more packed into a nice little case, and it's priced brilliantly low. It works like a charm, has MULTIPLE TIPS, and served its purpose admirably. I wholeheartedly recommend this kit. For basic repairs you don't need any other tools.
customer_reviews.author: Jim M

customer_reviews.title: Great soldering iron
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this one works really well. The heat is adjustable, and the heat is very even across the entire tip. Soldered on some legs on an Arduino Nano, and it was awesome to be able to use the small tip getting really good solders and quickly too. Highly recommended. Also used the suction device today, and it was my first time using one of those, and it worked really well too.
customer_reviews.author: Petter

customer_reviews.title: Incredible for the price
customer_reviews.text: For a very inexpensive soldering iron this is definitely a powerful and versatile tool. It heats up quickly in about 30 seconds from cold and the selection of heads provided with it make it ideal for most soldering jobs. I've only used it a few times since purchasing but it's definitely been very quick and easy to use at those tasks. If you need a good soldering iron and money is tight, you won't find much better than this.
customer_reviews.author: Sov

customer_reviews.title: A nice, cost effective and functional Soldering Kit.
customer_reviews.text: A nice, cost effective and functional Soldering Kit. Soldering iron heats up quickly (within about 25 seconds) and has good selection of tips. Found that, if "tinned" properly on first use, the tips last an exceptionally long time. Temperature dial on iron is nice feature though unable to verify dial accuracy. I use the iron at dial setting between 250 to 300 °F. Have built many electronic circuits soldered with this soldering iron. Only drawback I've experienced is the handle starts to get very uncomfortably warm after about 45 minutes continuous of use.
customer_reviews.author: Bayou Reader

customer_reviews.title: It is fine for my needs
customer_reviews.text: Years ago I bought what I thought was a professional grade Soldering iron. Bench style, fully adjustable with LCD read out and the wire iron holder with the little wet sponge deal, the works. I didn't need all of that but I figured why not? After only a few uses and just past the one year warranty, the LCD read out went dark then the whole deal folded on me like cheap lawn furniture. So I bought this one on a lightning deal and if it fades on me at least I ain't out of much money. Even if I only get several uses out of it, it will beat the "pro" model. I will see.
customer_reviews.author: FatDogOne

customer_reviews.title: excellent buy!
customer_reviews.text: this soldering kit has everything you need for small projects requiring heat: from soldering to melting plastic or burning wood. The one thing that confused me initially is the fact that I used the wrong head attachment to solder, likely the one for plastic. The soldering iron has enough heads to fit all your needs. It has a thermostat as well so you can regulate your temperature. The solder sucker /pump works. All fits in the box, including some extra solder and resin. PERFECT!
customer_reviews.author: R. Consta

customer_reviews.title: DEcent, basic, soldering iron for a quickly needed task.
customer_reviews.text: The carrying case is very cheap. My hinges became mis-aligned and warped, so my case doesn't close properly (after the 2nd use) anymore. The soldering iron itself is super basic, which is what I wanted, and pretty easy to use. I haven't really soldered anything before, and I was able to replace two faulty drone motors with ease. The stand is pretty bare bones, just bend some metal to make a standing spot for the iron. It doesn't hold it super well, and can easily get moved/bumped and then the iron can fall over. Overall if you're looking for an inexpensive soldering iron, without expecting much extra, this is probably the soldering iron for you.
customer_reviews.author: Jason R

customer_reviews.title: Value for money? Yes.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I needed to replace the switches in a mouse that was having some double-click issues among other things. Didn't want to spend a ton of money if I never used the thing again. Everything worked perfectly, as far as I could tell, having never soldered before and just taught myself via YouTube videos. The stand is really light, obviously, but as long as you're careful-ish it shouldn't be an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Seth

customer_reviews.title: Still working great 3 months later!
customer_reviews.text: I love the adjustable temp on this, and all the others things that come with it are great! Like the extra/different tips, sponge, tweezers, solder, and case! I've used the for many projects and it has been great, but BEWARE this won't work on lead free solder! You should have something that gets hotter for any lead free solders.
customer_reviews.author: cj

customer_reviews.title: Update: they sent me a functioning item.
customer_reviews.text: Update: the company contacted me, apologized and sent me a new functioning item which is great, but then they harassed me to write a review. They need to understand that is NOT my responsibility to write them a review, and I should have gotten a functioning product in the first place so I will increase a couple of stars but they need to improve that aspect from their customer service. Original message: The product doesn't work. It doesn't heat up at all. The box is cute though, so I'll give it one star for that. I tried to contact the manufacturer on the email provided in the little brochure but the email account doesn't exist.
customer_reviews.author: Madi & Pablo

customer_reviews.title: Awesome iron.
customer_reviews.text: So much easier to solder with proper equipment. This has a multitude of tips provided and a few accessories which are nice. The only reason I deducted one star for temperature control is somewhat not fair in that my eyes are old.. Still they could size up the print or the control knob a bit to resolve. Over all though still a 5 star for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Lana & Pat Schweitzer

customer_reviews.title: Low quality
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this a year ago and finally got To use it now, it’s an OK iron but.. the area that holds the bottom part of the hot end disintegrated and broke, then the iron fell out and burned me! :) if you want to use it more than a few times, buy something a little high quality
customer_reviews.author: Caroline

customer_reviews.title: Cute toy
customer_reviews.text: This toy should be marketed as such. You can't do real work with this. Spend your money on a real soldering station if you want to avoid the frustration using something that can barely provide heat. I would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Product arrived defective and doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived in a timely manor. When I plug the Soldering Iron in, the power light turns on, but it does not heat up. I trouble shooted the issue and still nothing. I will be returning this item and purchasing a different brand. Extremely disappointed and huge inconvenience.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Great kit if you have teens that have taken an ...
customer_reviews.text: This soldering iron kit comes with everything you need to get started with soldering. Great kit if you have teens that have taken an interest in tech and you dont want them using yours :). Pros: -Adjustable Temp soldering iron heats up fast and keeps its temp well - All the parts that were listed were in the kit -Affordable -Great for electronic projects Cons: -Case has a interesting plastic smell when opened. -Cable for soldering iron is not very long make sure you have a power outlet close to where you are working or have an extension cable.
customer_reviews.author: Evan La Fleur

customer_reviews.title: It's a nice unit. It works well so far although I've ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm a neophyte to soldering. I bought this to build a couple of science projects for my son (mini tesla coil and some electromagnets). It's a nice unit. It works well so far although I've only used it a few times so far. The only thing I did notice is that its easy to accidentally turn the temperature up or down on it without even noticing. That's the only gripe I have about it. Also, the tweezers are REALLY nice. I used them to pull some small metal pieces out of my hands (unrelated to my soldering work).
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Great for 3d print finishing
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to use in post-print finishing of 3d printed materials. Works well, the lower end of the temperature settings is perfect for smoothing and welding PLA plastic. The little bent metal stand is pretty useless, it won't fit in the case raised to hold the iron and will break very quickly if it's flattened and bent more than just a couple of times.
customer_reviews.author: mynxkatTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to soldering. This kit has done all I have asked for it as of yet. I'm doing LED projects so it requires a lot of small solder work. I also bought a helping hands. Heats up quick, tweezers are cheap, stand is cheap, everything else works pretty much as well as I could have hoped for. Would recommend for any general solder work.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisH

customer_reviews.title: Just Right
customer_reviews.text: I read a few reviews before selecting this specific soldering kit. I used it yesterday to install new speakers in my wife car. It worked exactly as I had hoped. Everything I needed was in the case, making it exceed my expectations. It may not be ideal for someone looking to use daily, but it's absolutely perfect for DIY-ers like me. Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Dave J

customer_reviews.title: Great set for the novice (me) soldering job
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little kit for some novice soldering. I bought it because my old one crapped out after 20 years. I like that it comes with its own little box and different tips, solder, etc...everything you need to get started. I used it for soldering 20 AWG speaker wire to some low-voltage LED lighting for the soffits of my house. Worked great 👍
customer_reviews.author: JAO

customer_reviews.title: Looks and feel cheap!
customer_reviews.text: granted, this is not an expensive soldering iron, but the $9.99 Wen irons look and feel more durable. It does heat up enough to tin wires, but to create an effective solder joint on 12 gauge wire was challenging. I don't know if the heat adjustment works. I had it turned all the way up to tine 16ga, 14 ga, and 12 ga wires. The tips range from very small to small with one medium wedge tip. The iron stand is very cheaply made and will not last long if you fold it for storage. I would not buy this again!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Doan

customer_reviews.title: One time use
customer_reviews.text: It worked for an hour or so. Next time I went for it I found it dead.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon User

customer_reviews.title: Best Soldering Kit for The Price
customer_reviews.text: I found this soldering kit extremely helpful for all my soldering needs. Additionally, the price is extremely affordable! This kit has everything needed in order to fix up that broken set of headphones you have been meaning to fix for the past month. Usually a kit would not include the various parts this kit included, but this all in one product helped me accomplish all my soldering needs. I cannot recommend this product enough! 5/5 product packaging 5/5 product 5/5 price
customer_reviews.author: Jake B

customer_reviews.title: Defective soldering iron (temp dial does not work). Seller ...
customer_reviews.text: Defective soldering iron (temp dial does not work). Seller did not replace as promised Suggest pay a little more and buy a decent iron (with a separate power supply). Amazon has several available
customer_reviews.author: Fair Comment

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality junk
customer_reviews.text: Temp dial is so small, numbers aren't readable. Temp dial was wobbly and fell off during first unsuccessful attempt to use. Post that holds dial on is about as thick as a human hair. Returning. Delivery was late also.
customer_reviews.author: MJC Raidas

customer_reviews.title: Horrible soldering tips - piece of garbage iron.
customer_reviews.text: This iron is a piece of garbage. The tips only last a few hours before corroding and solder doesn't flow anymore. I have done electronics work for over 20 years and this iron is the worst I have ever used. I use a soldering iron for electronic prototypes, and I will never buy one of these again.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Stahla

customer_reviews.title: Iron itself is crap. Kit is decent!
customer_reviews.text: I like the stuff it came with. A decent kit overall. The soldering iron tips are garbage though. It definitely gets hot - but the tips just burn and the coating is trash and I have never gotten the tips to tin or been able to successfully solder anything.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb Faulkner

customer_reviews.title: good product for the price
customer_reviews.text: You cant beat the price; but if I have anything bad to say about it is the electrical cord / copper wire to power the device is waaaay too thin. How is it supposed to handle extensive or prolonged periods of uses on such a thin wire? Secondly and to a lesser extent; there is no switch and it is a instant on device. That normally would be a problem, but my trip to a hardware store fixed it. Now I have a soldering iron and a on/off switch attached it it. Overall a good product!!!
customer_reviews.author: drunkspider

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but does the job
customer_reviews.text: For less than $10, this tool does its job. Low quality, yes, but I knew beforehand so there was no surprise there. If I needed to do frequent soldering jobs I'd definitely look for something better. For one or two uses a year, it is good enough for me.
customer_reviews.author: Brian L.

customer_reviews.title: works like it should
customer_reviews.text: This works fine for me after loaning my Son in Law my small iron which never got returned ETC,ETC. I actually bought this didn't get it for free. I took one star off because the tube the solder came in broke when I tried to remove the top to tread the solder thru the hole. Great case and accessories Can someone post how to get free stuff?
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Nice package. Solid case and packing.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice kid, and I really like the way it looks and how it fits into the case. The case is of good quality as well. It’s not real large, so I didn’t have any trouble finding a spot for it in my garage. It’s a nice range of materials, and I think it will do the trick for me. Of course I would recommend that you watch some YouTube type videos to get familiar with how to solder. I think most people will be happy with this as an introductory level kit.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Good beginners kit.
customer_reviews.text: Great little beginners kit with everything you need. The sponge was a little lackluster though. No issues with temperature control.
customer_reviews.author: Atom Teuoxtonion

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for my simple job that could of had expensive consequences
customer_reviews.text: This product worked well for me when I needed it. Had to change a capacitor and relay on a refrigerator control panel that was going out. This kit did the simple job and saved me hundreds of dollars. The sucker, welding solder and accessories all worked for me and appear ready if needed to be there for me on the next simple job. I'm not complaining at $13.
customer_reviews.author: eric reich

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Definitely worth the money. This is the cheapest kit that you can find on Amazon. Carry case is a really cool thing to have. But I wish it include soldering flux, just an idea for the seller. Overall this a great product. Quality is really impressive for this price, good cable, nice quality materials. Works perfect for my small RC projects.
customer_reviews.author: Crebri

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great kit for soldering. It has mostly everything you need to get started. The stand that came with the product is just a cut-out piece of metal that you can bend into a stand. I would suggest getting a separate stand. The desoldering pump that comes with the kit works great, it saves a lot of time and effort when you mistakenly solder something incorrectly. The soldering iron itself works as described, however the temperature dial has almost no resistance thus you might accidently change the temperature without noticing. And on a side note the temperature dial is in Celsius.
customer_reviews.author: Liu, Jacky

customer_reviews.title: Using this soldering kit to do a very fine soldering repair on a circuit board.
customer_reviews.text: The soldering kit was delivered quickly. All the parts were in the case. My son and I just used it to do some very fine soldering on a circuit board from an integrated amp. It worked very well. The very fine tip, included solder, and the variable temperature control on the soldering gun were very well suited for this very fine electrical repair. I will recommend this soldering kit to all my friends!!️ I am very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work at all - Avoid
customer_reviews.text: The package was missing a tip. Luckily I didn't need it. When I plugged it in, there was a loud pop and it never heated. Tried several power outlets to no avail. I needed this for a project and had to postpone it due to this. I'm scared to just get a replacement because I'm worried it will be the same low quality device that blew up immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew C.

customer_reviews.title: Quality!
customer_reviews.text: Wow.... used it today.... wow! I through out my old one it heats up so much faster and his the heat in the tip don much better than I could have hoped! Love it! Update: Heats up to 300 degrees (60% of temp dial) < 30 seconds (Like i got all my wires prepped for soldering, got frustrated that i had forgot to plug it in, it couldn't have been more than 10 seconds before i started soldering my wires on my drone... SUPER IMPRESSED!) Everything in here feels high quality (tweezers, and the iron especially (even the power cord))
customer_reviews.author: Don T Boyle

customer_reviews.title: Perfect kit for a newbie
customer_reviews.text: Never soldered before. I bought this to rewire a Stratocaster guitar. Perfect kit for a newbie. I do wish the temp gauge was a little more straightforward. I basically turned it until it melted stuff. Sometimes I had to back off, and while I'm not a total idiot, it wasn't as simple as "turn clockwise" to get the temp right.
customer_reviews.author: Honest MangoTop Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could give this a higher rating but cannot. I used the iron three times in six months then it died. I tried to see about purchasing a heating element for it but was pointed to buying a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Yolanda Ann

customer_reviews.title: Blew up in my hand! Luckily not injured!
customer_reviews.text: LOUD pop while using the Iron for the 5th time and nasty smell! REMIND YOU, There is no earthing on this Soldering iron. I was lucky not to get seriously burned or electrically shocked after I tossed it on the table! Asking for refund immediately! Smells like rotten fish!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: but I invested in a better kit once I realized the power adjustment doesn't seem ...
customer_reviews.text: Did what I need it to do, but I invested in a better kit once I realized the power adjustment doesn't seem to work. If you don't know what you're doing, you'll burn the bejesus out of what you're working on (especially fellow guitarists...WATCH THOSE VOLUME AND TONE POTS! This thing will melt through them like butter lol).
customer_reviews.author: Head Cheeze

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I was in need of a new soldering iron for my R/C cars, motors and battery connections. My old weller bit the dust, this is pretty nice, it heats up to the full temp in a few seconds and does a decent enough job at melting silver solder compared to a few other less expensive brands of irons. I like that it has additional tips. The solder sucker is a spare for me as I bought one not long ago.
customer_reviews.author: Mister'nMisses

customer_reviews.title: Good novice kit. The enclosed material leaves much to be desired
customer_reviews.text: Nicely arranged and packaged in a hard plastic case lined in egg-crate foam. The manual could have been more instructional for the item instead of a basic soldering tips booklet. I prefer a manual to be specific to the item it applies to than a cookie cutter informational that would of been no help to a novice. The items are of good quality and the package is a great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Trusty Automotive Solutions, LLC

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the small tasks
customer_reviews.text: I got this as my go-to iron just wouldn't get what I needed done with the sharp point tip I was able to get my annoying task done without the annoyance it started out to be. It's a great little iron that is also adjustable. Couldn't be happier for what I got it for and the price was great. Saved me time and aggravation.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described, good starter kit/quick project kit
customer_reviews.text: Needed a soldering kit for a quick project. Received the product quick and was happily surprised at the quality. Would recommend for entry level/novice users.
customer_reviews.author: HanR

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, but...
customer_reviews.text: The spades on the plug are too small. I tried it in a bunch of different sockets, powerboards, extension cords, everything. I had to use a rubber band to keep it in a position where it actually made contact. Ended up just buying a replacement plug, should've just spent a few more bucks on the iron. I know I shouldn't expect top notch quality at this price, but I don't think a working plug is too much to ask.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Sergei Purne

customer_reviews.title: Great to start off with
customer_reviews.text: Great to start off with. Did few crafts with it. My rating is only on my personal use. Maybe the pros would be "this product is doesn't work for that" but i use it for small details. It worked great and did managed to fix some devices i had (like headphones). The design is great, just don't forget to wait long enough to pack it..
customer_reviews.author: Antonio Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Works really well, but feels cheap because it is. :)
customer_reviews.text: Feels cheap, but does everything I have asked of it. I have done some automotive, and wired up some MS connectors, fixed a bad switch on a circuit board, the hear control is great. I have no idea how accurate it is, but it does appear to go from warm to hot, so that's good enough for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Much better kit than the low price should allow
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised how nice this kit is. it worked great to desolder and solder new components inside my wireless mouse. Overall very happy with the variable temperature control and functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing product, very fine service
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing, I plugged it in, and it doesn't get hot (at all, not even warm). One can't solder with a room temperature soldering iron. Tabiger support responded to my review by offering to send a free soldering iron. Very disappointing product, but very fine service. I didn't take advantage of their offer because I had already replaced the tool, and didn't want to take advantage of Tabiger's resources just to have an extra soldering iron. 1 star product, 5 star service... averaging them, 3 star review.
customer_reviews.author: ericsmithcpa

customer_reviews.title: Iron stopped heating up after just a few hours of usage.
customer_reviews.text: Tip stopped heating up after only two days of using it to solder a few electronic parts in an old radio a couple of hours at each time. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I have 0 mechanical skills
customer_reviews.text: With the help of this little jewel, I was able to fix my Guitar for a 1/4 of what it would have cost for a professional to do it. And I learned that I can fix anything that needs soldering now. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony G.

customer_reviews.title: Solder Kit
customer_reviews.text: Works ok. Very cheaply made. Sucker is plastic. Holder is piece of sheet metal. Iron handle gets hot. But it works and has a case to keep it all together. I'm Satisfied for the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis D

customer_reviews.title: Broke in first 5 minutes
customer_reviews.text: Pure junk. Broke in less than 5 minutes. Just stopped working completely. Replaced the tips, nothing. Changed outlets, nothing. Just stopped working. Would give negative stars if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Drbblz

customer_reviews.title: Top notch kit for micro soldering on a budget.
customer_reviews.text: For the money this kit is top notch. I needed a decent soldering pencil that had a heat control for doing some micro soldering without spending a fortune. The various tips are heavy material and look like they will last a long time. Also the solder sucker works great. I was replacing the battery on a pair of blutooth earbuds and this kit was the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Bassnote77

customer_reviews.title: Lazy packaging, missing the iron
customer_reviews.text: This thing came without the soldering iron, so the entire thing is useless now. -UPDATE- I ordered another one and the seller refunded my first order. Their customer service is decent. The iron itself worked well for my first project, so this was a worthwhile buy. The folding metal stand for the iron is a bit iffy. It could easily slide off a table if pulled by the iron's power cord or it could tip over while the iron is resting on it. Be careful with it and consider getting a better stand.
customer_reviews.author: C. S.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap in $$$ and quality, but did the job.
customer_reviews.text: It is cheap $$$$ and that equals cheap quality.... the iron works, the solder sucker is cheap and... well it is cheap. The only thing worth buying it for is the iron and the tips. I would spend more next time IF I had a need to use it more often. It worked for my needs, so I guess it is kinda like that Freight store that sells the one time use tools, you get what you pay for and if it gets the job done, it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: S. Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: A friend of mine has one I asked him about it he loves it. I decided to get one. What can i say product came as shown and discrived hard case to keep it organice which I like. This tool kit is for the regular home owner it gets hot really quick different type of tip makes any job alot easier. I really recommend this kit
customer_reviews.author: Romarro

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but effective for small jobs
customer_reviews.text: PROS: Price, easy to use CONS: Cheap case, no desoldering wick, metal stand is cheap and ineffective at holding the unit Overall it worked well to help me fix some of my old Nintendo games, perfect for a beginner like me
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: 4 years & still going strong
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. Really good for beginners. I’ve had a few irons & this one is worth every penny. It’s compact & has everything you need. Case is well made & compact but still has a little room to add any of those little things you might want to add to the kit. Also, the tweezers that come with it are amazing quality.
customer_reviews.author: Sabarblatoe

customer_reviews.title: Really good kit for a beginner
customer_reviews.text: Really good kit for a beginner. Decent price point as well. Some of the items in the kit, you can tell that are not the greatest quality but for the price point it is a really good kit. If my review helped you in any way, please let me know by clicking the "helpful" button below. Any questions you may have, feel free to ask... Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Vlad

customer_reviews.title: Solid soldering kit for a decent price. It let ...
customer_reviews.text: Solid soldering kit for a decent price. It let me do exactly what I needed. The sponge is a bit small but that's not a huge deal at all and for the price I didn't expect much to begin with. If you need a soldering iron and don't want to spend much this thing will do the trick.
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: I would hate this iron if I had to solder with it ...
customer_reviews.text: As described. Nothing fancy. Melts solder and puts it where you ask it to be. This is not a feature-packed unit, and is arguably the cheapest quality you can buy. Very handy for a field-iron, or something you're not afraid of getting stolen. I would hate this iron if I had to solder with it every day, though I could still do decent work with it. Skill is important, but good tools can make the difference.
customer_reviews.author: Chris C.

customer_reviews.title: Temperature Control is Inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: The temp control dial on this iron is not accurate. If I set the dial to 300 Celsius it will stay in the 200's. When I turn it to 350 Celsius, it jumps up to the 400's. Sure I can use but I need to monitor it and stay on top of it. My confidence in this adjustable temp controlled soldering iron is very little, I cant trust it to be accurate. Invest in a digital instead. The case is nice and the extra tips are nice, but im going to replace the temperature dial with a better one.
customer_reviews.author: Banchee

customer_reviews.title: Handy piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed with this set so far. I have used it for soldering and stippling pistol magazines and has worked very well for both. The multiple tips are great.
customer_reviews.author: TXThinBlueLine

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding customer support
customer_reviews.text: The soldering iron works well. I received the kit without the spare tips and contacted Tabiger customer support. They were pleasant to deal with and were more than helpful. I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: SteveH

customer_reviews.title: BEST BANG FOR YOUR BUCK!
customer_reviews.text: You can't find a better soldering iron for the price. I just need to practice up bc I haven't used one in years. It has everything you need in the kit to get you started. Plus, the adjustable thermostat on the iron is great.. highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Josh Ramsey

customer_reviews.title: Fake
customer_reviews.text: What I got was a piece of crap, the temp control do not work, it was like from 0 to 350 it was like it was turn of, then from 350 to 600 the temparature was all the same, it was at full power. I think I recieve a counterfit
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Buy a better product
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with product. Cheaply made and temp. Setting unreliable
customer_reviews.author: Chris Cayton-Katie Herzberg

customer_reviews.title: Great back-up iron, or a portable kit for light work.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice little "on the go" soldering kit. I got it as a backup, and for going places to make repairs, and it works well so far. The included solder sucker is pretty crappy. I took it apart just to look inside, and almost cross-threaded it trying to put it back together, the plastic threads are so fine and poorly formed. Other than that, not bad as a back-up iron or portable kit.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Schiffmacher

customer_reviews.title: Excellent starting Soldering Iron
customer_reviews.text: For a guy like me doing small soldering jobs on my guitar etc, this little kit is perfect! It really comes with everything you need to start out especially if, like me you're just learning. Plenty of different sized tips, solder, a pincher tool, a solder sucker (very useful) a carrying case, a small metal stand and even a small sponge. It worked out really well for me and I'd recommend anyone on a budget just starting out to pick one up!
customer_reviews.author: jim beeson

customer_reviews.title: Full featured and with excellent performance
customer_reviews.text: This kit has everything you need! Fine tips, wedge tips, adjustable heat settings, and even a solder sucker. It worked perfectly for the fine soldering work needed for guitar electronics. The wiring looks fantastic instead of all gunky and lumpy. I would recommend this for anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn E Crapo

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: The unit works fine, gets plenty hot and is quick to get to temperature. I like the container it came in, I can put the soldering stuff in there and I don't have to go looking for it here and there. Hot enough to easily melt 1/8 roll solder for copper wires of 12 gauge.
customer_reviews.author: PC

customer_reviews.title: A well put together starter kit!
customer_reviews.text: This kit is nice, I used it to solder wires together as my first project and everything functioned well; it's lower quality but it gets the job done. The temperature dial is a nice touch, and I love the inexpensive solder sucker; this is perfect for anyone wanting to pick up a new skill!
customer_reviews.author: Alexandria O. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Truly a complete kit!
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality materials for this low price. A complete kit with everything necessary for immediate use. Even a small sponge for tip-cleaning and a simple heat-proof stand. And a good case to prevent pieces from being lost
customer_reviews.author: A. Westwood

customer_reviews.title: junk
customer_reviews.text: Product did not arrive for over two weeks. supposed to be two day delivery with prime. Unit did not work. turned on to full heat, no adjustment control. poor quality. purchased a different unit from another vendor that worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph  Dolph

customer_reviews.title: Contacted seller, made it right.
customer_reviews.text: Seemed good for the first 2 uses, third time I plugged it in it never heated up. Was always handled with care and put in the case. I may just happened to get a bad one. Contacted the seller and they sent me a new one, product was still under warranty.
customer_reviews.author: FREQUENCY247

customer_reviews.title: A low to heat transfer.
customer_reviews.text: Takes a while to transfer the heat, it works for me, I hardly do any soldering and when I do it's a a few connection. But one time I had to solder 10 wires and tOok me an hour with stripping the wire and twisting it but a lot of was waiting for it to transfer the heat to the wire.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus N.

product_meta.title: Tabiger Soldering Iron Kit 60W 110V-Adjustable Temperature Welding Soldering Iron with Tool Carry Case
feature_bullets: 【BASIC SOLDERING IRON KIT】: This package comes with soldering iron, 5 solder tips, stand, solder wire tube, anti-Static tweezer, desoldering pump and a durable tool case. This tool set can meet all of your soldering project needs.

【HEAT UP QUICKLY & ENERGY SAVING】: The 110V 60W soldering iron features an advanced ceramic printed heater to heat up to the targeted temperature quickly, and adjustable temperature range 200~450℃ with large venting holes make it much more energy-efficient.

【UPGRATED ONE-HANDED USE DESOLDERING PUMP】: The Solder sucker with simple construction, you can cock it and press the trigger button with one hand. High pressure vacuum can remove solder from a printed circuit board effectively. The body of desoldering pump is made of aluminum, which can resistance to beat, corrosion and have good heat dispersion.

【PORTABLE STORAGE TOOLBOX】: The multifunctional durable plastic case is rather convenient to store small tools and easy to carry, avoiding damage of the soldering gun and all accessories with inner protective layer.

【APPLICATION & WARRANTY】: With this multifunctional tool kit, you can repairing various electronics and circuit board, like welding, jewelry, guitar, watches, wiring, mobile device, computers hardware, small electronic work, TV capacitors or accessories, trinkets of children, crafts and more. TABIGER promises a 12 months product warranty and free lifetime customer support. Please contact us if you have any problems.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,819 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
